Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @vayrak right now Hush has a healthy + thriving mining community and we would like to bring that to BTCH as well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if that happens, the BTCH development fund will greatly benefit Hush in the future, where as now we basically only have funds to pay monthly server expenses. BTCH and HUSH are a team of coins, one doing well benefits the other. That is how I look at it anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> And Staking BTCH will replenish the project budget and its entire community. It will be good for  all of us

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Increasing liquidity, as @kh4567 mentioned, is important too. Because there is no mining, liquidity of BTCH is pretty low. Selling any decent amount of BTCH right now crashes the price

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> As I understand Komodo gives about 5% a year to coin holders on Agama wallet, Do you consider the option of such a reward, but only with a higher percentage?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I have never sold BTCH, but I paid radix42 in BTCH to do some work and he had a very had time selling it, and crashed the price by selling something like 500 BTCH from the bounty I gave him. Liquidity is important

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Takoy_Nahal for whatever reason, I don't think asset chains can have interest (the 5%), it's only for KMD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if we do staking, that is essentially equivalent to some kind of % interest. You get rewarded for HODLing. Interest happens on coins even if they are lost or dead, while staking requires the coins to be actually online

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so staking rewards active nodes, which is probably healthy for the network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> Yes this is useful for the network, thereby maintaining its stability. I personally like the system from Veruscoin, but recently large holders have seized the network and the blocks have come rarely. It seems that there is no protection from it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it looks very probable that BTCH will be 50/50 PoW/PoS to protect current HODLers positions while also be attractive to miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also, we are very seriously looking at VerusHash instead of Equihash, which would mean CPU mining versus ASIC mining

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> BTCH could be CPU-friendly to mine *and* have 51% attack protection, not sure many coins have that combination

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if any

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Berg> 
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/407861562108542988/485102004386005003/image0.png

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's not possible to make a new KMD AC with VerusHash right this second, but it's coming very soon. CHIPS is also looking at converting to VerusHash as well, and I am helping a bit with that to learn all the details about VerusHash internals

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Berg interesting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ASIC-resistance is such a weird marketing term üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> One of those blanket terms that piques everyones interest. Seems to be all people talk about when it comes to mining üòÅ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> VerusHash is CPU-optimized, that is what I like to say. CPUs mine it best. There exist some un-released GPU miners for VerusHash, but they perform worse that CPU miners, and are not compatible with using risers and you cannot CPU+GPU mine at the same time. So GPU mining Verus is pretty much not a good idea

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and building an ASIC to do VerusHash faster than a recent CPU would cost bajillions of dollars

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so that is why CPUs are so good. VerusHash leverages what CPUs do best, by using AES/AVX CPU instructions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> VerusHash rests on decades of Intel/AMD research to make CPUs as powerful and cheap as possible. It will be a long time until VerusHash ASICs make sense, but one day they could

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I lean toward VerusHash for BTCH, even as somebody who has a z9 in the mail. The process of buying a z9, the cost, the international customs and taxes, .... , it's not something the masses have access to. CPU mining with VerusHash just seems a lot more "fair", in the sense that everybody has to use the same hardware. You can't buy hw that is exponentially better than the average person can. That levels things

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i think it will be cool to have Hush mineable via ASICs and then BTCH CPU-mineable, it will give us quite a cross-section of miners, people can choose either or

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i also have plans to port the Hush webminer to be a BTCH webminer. VerusHash is much friendlier to webmining

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> i already have a prototype that can mine KMD or some asset chain in the browser, what's left is to port the current WebAssembly from Equihash to VerusHash. If anybody wants to help, let me know üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @dukeleto  It will be fine, if BTCH realizes the conceived, HUSH + BTCH will cover the whole spectrum of miners and Hodlers. Universality is a big plus. Taking into account the work of your team, how much time will it take to accomplish BTCH mining?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't have any timelines. It's not going to be tomorrow or next week, I can tell you that. The lead dev of Veruscoin is working on submitting a PR to Komodo that adds VerusHash, when that happens, we will be able to create the new chain. We also need to allow some time to tell the community when the hardfork is, i.e. a specific block height, and give our exchanges some notice for them to update

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I do agree that as much transparency in this new fork of BTCH is best, so I will make some kind of "list of all the things that need to happen to create the BTCH fork" on github, and that will hopefully give a lot more insight into exactly where we are

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> TLDR: BTCH will become a CPU-friendly coin (same algo as VRSC), and also ~50% of block reward will go to those staking BTCH in their full node. It will continue to have 51% attack protection from KMD, and the new fork will be able to do cryptoconditions (smart contracts). BTCH will not be profitable to mine on GPUs or ASICs for a long time, if ever

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I think the reason we see BTCH price climbing is that people rightly realize that BTCH will become something like a bond, where it pays out X% via staking rewards, based on how much you are staking and the total amount being staked on the network at that time. This same thing happened in the VRSC community very early on, but they had almost no circulating supply so the market dynamics won't be exactly the same.

[dscrd-hush] <exile13> Is there any info available on running a ‚Äònode‚Äô on the hush network? I cannot seem to locate any...I.e. wallet requirements, uptime required and such. Or am I ahead of the curve? 
I‚Äôve been researching crypto for some time now, and am learning Linux. My background is graphics and reiki. I do not think that being ‚ÄòASIC resistant‚Äô supports ‚Äòdecentalization‚Äô because some central company somewhere created a device to do a certain thing. GPUs, cpus, any unit has to be created, therefore materials and labor must be combined to produce a certain outcome. Is nature open source? Perhaps in knowledge or sensory data, yet the physical boundaries are finite. In this respect energy cannot be taken that does not exist. The 50-60 cycle hz that most of our electricity in the cities run, lose power over distance and do not allow effective charge compression. 
I believe that my money really is in jimmies house, and Eric‚Äôs, Rubin is investing with it , and Mira is pay for her college tuition with it. I did not come into this world alone, or have I learned much from only reflection, because we are here together, as a result of everything we have seen heard and experienced. That‚Äôs why I like block chain and crypto.
Much love
